Detailed Description

Base class for GLSL shaders used in DAZ Studio.

This class implements all the compiling and linking functionality necessary to use a GLSL shader, subclasses need only supply the code for the shader, and provide functionality to set parameters for the shader.

Member Function Documentation

bool DzOpenGLShader::doTestCompile ( QString *  output = NULL  ) 

Compiles and links the shader, and appends any output messages (including errors and warnings) to output if it is non-NULL.

Parameters:
output If non-null, output messages will be appended to this string
Returns:
true if the shader compiled and linked successfully.

Convenience function for getting the index of the attribute variable with the given name.

Parameters:
name The name of the parameter

Convenience function for getting the index of the uniform variable with the given name.

Parameters:
name The name of the parameter
bool DzOpenGLShader::isValid (  )  const

Attempts to compile the shader if necessary, and returns true if the shader was compiled, and linked without any errors.

Returns:
true if the code of the shader has been compiled and linked into a usable shader program.
void DzOpenGLShader::setFragmentShader ( const QString &  code,
bool  isFile = false 
)

Sets the code for the fragment shader portion of the shader program.

Parameters:
code The actual code for the fragment shader, or a filename containing the code.
isFile If this is false, code is assumed to contain the actual lines of code for the shader. Otherwise, code is expected to contain a path to a text file that contains the code.
void DzOpenGLShader::setGL ( const DzCamera *  cam  )  const [virtual]

Makes this shader the active shader program, if it is valid.

Parameters:
cam The camera to use

Reimplemented in DzOGLDefaultShader.

bool  isFile = false

Parameters:
